info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Mecklenburg and northern Union Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 559 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles east of Uptown Charlotte to 7 miles northeast of Indian Land. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters and Doppler radar estimates. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Unionville, Wesley Chapel, Wingate and Lake Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
